name: HATS-46
scenarioDescription:
The HATS-46 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HATS-46 is a star with 0.92 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.85 times its radius. It is located 1461.17888 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HATS-46 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HATS-46 system

HATS-46 b

HATS-46 b was discovered by the HATSouth observatory using the Transit method. The mass of HATS-46 b is 54.98459 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HATS-46 b is 10.122 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HATS-46 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, HATS-46 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HATS-46, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATSouth.
